item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司 1.9 亿英镑债务交易，救援谈判遥遥无期
item.description: 本周，泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water）的一大笔债务易手，因为有关拯救这家濒临破产的公用事业公司的谈判尚未取得突破性进展。【原文：A chunk of Thames Water’s debt changed hands this week as negotiations over a rescue plan for the ailing utility have yet to yield a breakthrough.】

item.description: 南非中央银行绕过财政部，单方面下调了通胀目标。【原文：South Africa’s central bank has unilaterally lowered its inflation target, bypassing the finance ministry, which insists it alone holds the authority to set policy.】

item.title: 比特币在破纪录的七月后回落至三周低点
item.description: 比特币连续第五个交易日下跌，因为交易商继续从 7 月份美国拥抱数字资产的兴奋期所创下的历史高点回撤。【原文：Bitcoin declined for a fifth straight session as traders continue to pull back from the record highs reached in July during the euphoria around the US embrace of digital assets.】

item.title: 巴宝莉成为焦点，英国在欧洲并购目标调查中占主导地位
item.description: 包括巴宝莉集团（Burberry Group Plc）在内的英国公司在被视为潜在收购目标的欧洲上市企业中占据着主导地位，英国股票估值的折扣使它们对买家的吸引力与日俱增。【原文：British companies including Burberry Group Plc dominate the ranks of European listed firms tipped as potential takeover targets, with discounted UK equity valuations making them increasingly enticing to buyers.】

item.title: 花旗银行认为美国加征关税后非洲将与中国和欧盟开展更多贸易
item.description: 花旗集团地区办事处负责人表示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布一系列新关税措施后，非洲的贸易流可能会进一步远离美国。【原文：African trade flows may shift further away from the US after President Donald Trump announced a slew of new tariffs, the head of Citigroup Inc.’s regional office said.】

item.title: 特朗普征收 25% 关税后，印度有望与美国进一步谈判
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对南亚国家征收 25% 的关税后，新德里的一位官员表示，印度期待美国贸易谈判代表本月晚些时候访问该国，继续就双边协议进行谈判。【原文：India expects US trade negotiators to visit the country later this month to continue talks on a bilateral deal, an official in New Delhi said, after President Donald Trump hit the South Asian nation with a 25% tariff.】

item.title: 埃克森公司盈利超出预期，石油产量缓解油价跌势
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司公布的业绩好于预期，原因是二叠纪盆地和圭亚那的石油产量强劲，缓解了原油价格下跌的影响。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. posted better-than-expected results after robust oil production from the Permian Basin and Guyana cushioned the impact of lower crude prices.】

item.title: Rokos 加入对冲基金行列，返还现金以限制资产飙升
item.description: 宏观交易专家克里斯-罗科斯（Chris Rokos）正准备首次将其对冲基金的现金交还给客户，加入史蒂夫-科恩（Steve Cohen）和肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）等同行的行列，放弃资本以限制其资金池的规模。【原文：Macro trading specialist Chris Rokos is preparing to hand back cash from his hedge fund to clients for the first time, joining peers such as Steve Cohen and Ken Griffin in spurning capital to restrict the size of their money pools.】

item.title: 美联储缩减开支，债券交易员密切关注就业数据
item.description:
过去一年中，两年期收益率平均因就业报告而变动了10个基点。【原文：

Two-year yields have moved an average 10 basis points on employment report over past year.

】

item.title: 日本央行观察家在贸易协议达成后提前发出下一次加息呼吁
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布了包括与日本达成的一项协议在内的多项贸易协议，从而使贸易问题更加明朗，日本央行观察人士提前预测了下一次加息的时间。【原文：Bank of Japan watchers brought forward their forecast for when they expect the next interest rate hike, after clarity over trade increased with US President Donald Trump announcing deals including one with Japan.】

item.title: 燃料成本飙升后，巴基斯坦 7 月通胀加速
item.description: 在政府提高国内燃料价格后，巴基斯坦的通货膨胀加速，这证明了决策者两天前出人意料地维持政策利率不变的决定是正确的。【原文：Pakistan’s inflation accelerated after the government increased domestic fuel prices, vindicating a decision by policymakers two days ago to unexpectedly keep policy rate unchanged.】

item.title: 引发韩国股市暴跌的税收计划被迫重新审议
item.description: 韩国对公司和投资者增税的计划导致周五全球最热门市场之一的韩国股市突然暴跌，韩国正面临着越来越多的不满，这可能会给总统李在明的国内议程带来麻烦。【原文：South Korea’s plan to hike taxes on companies and investors, which caused a sudden slump in one of the world’s hottest markets on Friday, is facing mounting discontent that could spell trouble for President Lee Jae Myung’s domestic agenda.】

item.title: 中国将点名批评破坏性价格战的企业
item.description: 中国正在打击一些公司为赢得市场份额而提供的低价，并计划将那些它认为最严重的违规公司公之于众。【原文：China is taking aim at low prices offered by companies to win market share and plans to expose those it deems the worst offenders to public scrutiny.】

item.title: 印度将如何受到特朗普互惠关税的伤害
item.description: "关税之王"关税的 "滥用大户"。一个 "非常高关税的国家"。美国总统唐纳德-特朗普多年来多次明确表达了他对印度贸易保护主义政策的看法。【原文：“Tariff king.” A “big abuser” of tariffs. A “very high tariff nation.” US President Donald Trump has made it clear repeatedly over the years what he thinks of India’s protectionist trade policies.】

item.title: 对冲基金抛售美股，认为关税问题仍存风险
item.description: 美国 500 指数（S&P 500 Index）在历史高点附近徘徊，这种无情的反弹仍未能说服华尔街的聪明人放弃看跌的观点。【原文：The relentless rally that has the S&P 500 Index hovering near all-time highs still hasn’t convinced Wall Street’s smart money to give up on their bearish views.】

item.title: 特朗普回合 "将美国从基于规则的世界贸易体系中解脱出来
item.description: 昨晚，美国贸易代表杰米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer）在宣布唐纳德-特朗普总统修改后的全球关税措施时，对华盛顿在过去十年中任由其萎缩的以规则为基础的国际贸易体系进行了嘲讽。【原文：In announcing President Donald Trump’s revised barrage of global tariffs last night, US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer had a dig at the rules-based international trading system that Washington has let atrophy for much of the past decade.】

item.title: 湄公河资本支持的 F88 下周将在越南开始交易
item.description: 根据河内证券交易所网站上的一份声明，由湄公河资本有限公司（Mekong Capital Ltd.）支持的越南金融公司F88 Co.将于下周开始在非上市公众公司市场交易。【原文：Vietnamese finance company F88 Co., backed by Mekong Capital Ltd., will begin trading next week on the Unlisted Public Company Market, according to a statement on the Hanoi Stock Exchange’s website.】

item.title: 交易员逆势押注欧洲央行减息，瞄准丰厚回报
item.description: 如果欧洲央行不负众望，在未来几个月继续降息，那么交易商们就会大赚一笔。【原文：Traders are accumulating wagers that will pay off handsomely if the European Central Bank defies expectations and continues to cut interest rates over the coming months.】

item.title: 香港将允许大基金获得更大比例的上市交易
item.description: 在一些公司上市引发零售狂潮之后，香港将允许大型基金获得更大比例的新上市股票。【原文：Hong Kong will let big funds secure a bigger proportion of shares offered for new listings after some companies that went public sparked a retail frenzy in the city.】

item.title: 调查发现，大多数南非小型企业面临倒闭风险
item.description: 由贷款机构 Absa Group Ltd. 支持的一项调查发现，南非一半以上的小企业预计存活时间不会超过一年。【原文：More than half South Africa’s small businesses don’t expect to survive for more than a year, a survey backed by lender Absa Group Ltd. found.】

item.title: 欧元区通胀率维持在 2%，支持欧洲央行对利率的谨慎态度
item.description: 欧元区的通胀率保持在欧洲中央银行的目标水平，为那些表示不急于继续降息的官员提供了支持。【原文：Euro-area inflation held at the European Central Bank’s target, supporting the case for officials who say there’s no rush to keep lowering interest rates.】

item.title: 尽管美国加征关税，南非工厂仍摆脱萎缩态势
item.description: 尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策迫在眉睫，但南非制造商的景气指数在需求大幅复苏的情况下有所改善，九个月来首次进入扩张区间。【原文：A gauge of South African manufacturers’ sentiment improved amid a sharp recovery in demand, advancing into expansionary territory for the first time in nine months despite US President Donald Trump’s looming tariffs.】

item.title: 法国葡萄酒出口商因特朗普关税损失 10 亿欧元
item.description: 如果美国下周继续对法国葡萄酒和烈酒产品征收 15%的进口关税，法国葡萄酒和烈酒行业预计将损失 10 亿欧元，因为欧盟正在为获得豁免做最后的努力。【原文：France’s wine and spirits industry expects to lose €1 billion should the US go ahead with imposing a 15% import tariff on their products next week, as the European Union makes a last-ditch effort to obtain an exemption.】

item.title: 欧元因欧美贸易协定问题将迎来 2022 年以来最差一周
item.description: 由于市场对欧洲与美国达成的贸易协议的经济影响产生担忧，欧元兑美元汇率本周将创下近三年来的最差记录。【原文：The euro is headed for its worst week in almost three years against the dollar as concern seeped in to the market about the economic impact of Europe’s trade deal with the US.】

item.title: 美银美林哈特内特：美国大型科技股涨势看似有限
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp. ）的策略师说，自 4 月份以来，推动所谓的 "华丽七股 "上涨 45% 的涨势看起来已被拉长。【原文：The rally that’s propelled the so-called Magnificent Seven stocks 45% higher since April looks stretched, Bank of America Corp. strategists say.】
